p: Analysis of the methanolic extract of Streptomyces sp. strain DBT34 indicated that it had strong antioxidant activity as demonstrated by its DPPH and ABTS radical scavenging activity, producing IC 50 values of 41.5 µg/mL and 47.8 µg/mL, respectively. These results indicate that low concentrations of the methanolic extract of strain DBT34 are capable of reducing DPPH and ABTS radicals, further demonstrating that strain DBT34 represents a potent source of antioxidant compounds that will degrade ROS ( Figure 3).
